org.kitesdk.data

Interface DatasetRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.kitesdk.data.spi.DatasetRepository
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    org.kitesdk.data.spi.RandomAccessDatasetRepository, RandomAccessDatasetRepository
    Deprecated. 
    will be removed in 0.17.0. Move to using Datasets instead

    @Immutable
@Deprecated
public interface DatasetRepository
extends org.kitesdk.data.spi.DatasetRepository

    A logical repository (storage system) of Datasets.

    Implementations of DatasetRepository are storage systems that contain zero or more Datasets. A repository acts as a factory, as well as a registry, of datasets. You can DatasetRepository.create(String, DatasetDescriptor) a new Dataset with a name and schema, or retrieve a handle to an existing dataset, by name, by way of the DatasetRepository.load(String) method. While not expressly forbidden, most repositories are expected to support only a single concrete Dataset implementation.

    No guarantees are made as to the durability, reliability, or availability of the underlying storage. That is, a DatasetRepository could be on disk, in memory, or some combination. See the implementation class for details about the guarantees it provides.

    Implementations of DatasetRepository are immutable.

    See Also:
    Dataset, DatasetDescriptor

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface org.kitesdk.data.spi.DatasetRepository

        create, create, delete, exists, getUri, list, load, load, update, update
